title: How to Grow a Birdhouse Gourd

steps.headline: Sow the seeds on mounds made of well-draining soil a few feet apart with two to three seeds per hill.
Thin the weaker seedling(s) once they emerge.
Give a daily drench watering and increase watering slightly once you see small gourds emerging.
Once the gourds become larger, place hay below them so that they don't rot.
Alternatively, train the gourds up a trellis or fence to produce round-bottomed gourds, which is the preferred method if the gourds will be used for decoration.

text: Sow the seeds on mounds made of well-draining soil a few feet apart with two to three seeds per hill.  Thin the weaker seedling(s) once they emerge.  Give a daily drench watering and increase watering slightly once you see small gourds emerging.  Once the gourds become larger, place hay below them so that they don't rot.  Alternatively, train the gourds up a trellis or fence to produce round-bottomed gourds, which is the preferred method if the gourds will be used for decoration.
